lines.text: [Two ghosts argue about the family finances]
All you left Ma and me was a fifteen-dollar saloon bill.
I'll thank you to treat you father with more respect.
Why, I'm twice as old as you are!
[After Jennifer Griggs and her boyfriend are soaked by rain, Jennifer quickly exchanges her wet dress for a provocative blanket]
What does she do?
She's a librarian.
Must read a lot.
[Sam the ghost walks through his first wall]
Look, Pa, no hands!
Just as easy as I used to go through a week's pay.
I've been thinking this thing over, and your sister's right.
About my going to England?
No, of course not.
[to Amy]
About Jimmy here being a good worker and deserving a raise.
[to Jim]
As a matter of fact, I intended to give you one on your birthday next month.
Liar!
That's very nice of you, Uncle Ralph, but you see I've made up my mind...
That's not all. I'm putting you in charge of the fish balls!
Can that be a promotion?
But money just doesn't vanish into thin air!
Oh, doesn't it! It's easy to see he hasn't handled much of it.
I'm sorry, Jim... for you.
So am I... for you.
I'm sorry too.
Well, you can all stop being so darn sorry for each other!
What strange unnatural storms!
What does she want with her storms, affidavits of authenticity?
